title: extra light geometric slab serif
content:
Can anybody help me identify this font?

Cheers!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [meta.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/typophile.com/files/meta.JPG) | 58.08 KB |

 [‹ Please Identify This Font from 944 Magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45641 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please identify this font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45603 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Lirak

comments.content:
Try the Museo range from myfonts.com.

100 should do the trick. 300 and 600 are free if you want something bolder.

If not try Archer at [www.typography.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/www.typography.com/ "www.typography.com")

Ged

Stymie Light is close ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stymie/ef-light/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stymie/ef-light/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stymie/ef-light/")), as is Lubalin Graph ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-lubalin-graph/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-lubalin-graph/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-lubalin-graph/")) — though I don’t know if there’s an extralight version.
wow I am intrigued by this one it is like a combination of Lubalin Graph vs Museo... I quite like it

The old Image Club version of [ITC Stymie Hairline](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsamples/serif_s/stymie_hairline_full.gif) is almost exactly like this. The M seems to be the only letter I can see that is different, and the serifs seem removed from the one used in ’Meta’. (The sample shown is from the [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907171132/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/intro.php))

- Mike Yanega
thank you all for your help!! :)

Hi the lowercase ’l’ is way different hence the cross between Museo and Lubalin or Stymie... the ’l’ is what really has me searching, though I would maybe think a customised typeface?.. or a commissioned?
I really would like to know what this is.

I think customized is a good guess.

- Mike Yanega
